com.milk.gui
Class TextOutputPanel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--javax.swing.JComponent
                    |
                    +--javax.swing.JPanel
                          |
                          +--com.milk.gui.TextOutputPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class TextOutputPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

This is just a simple panel which shows any text spit at it through the streams it provides for such spitting.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.
See Also:
Serialized Form

Nested Class Summary
private  class TextOutputPanel.DocResizeListener
          This is a ComponentListener that looks for the text pane to be resized and then does the scroll-to-bottom thing.
private  class TextOutputPanel.MyOutputStream
          This is the OutputStream class that knows how to put stuff in this panel.
private  class TextOutputPanel.MyWriter
          This is the Writer class that knows how to put stuff in this panel.

Method Detail

getOutputStream

public java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
Get the OutputStream which can be written to to get stuff to show up in this panel. Note that, if possible, you should use getWriter() instead of this method, but the Java System.{out,err} legacy forces the use of OutputStreams. It just sucks that way.

Returns:
the OutputStream

getWriter

public java.io.Writer getWriter()
Get the Writer which can be written to to get stuff to show up in this panel.

Returns:
the Writer
